info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 1:07PM PST until December 28 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT... Snow accumulations of up to 10 to 16 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades, north of Howard Prairie. This includes Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Willamette Pass, and highways 140, 62, 230, 138 and 58. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... The highest accumulations are expected at elevations above 5000 feet, including the vicinities of Willamette Pass, Diamond Lake, Crater Lake, and Lake of the Woods. Snowfall rates of 1"/hr are have a 70% chance of occuring around Diamond Lake and Willamette Pass. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
